commit message: Initial commit.
Added license information.
Added build instructions.
Code cleanup, moved Fragment into seperate file, added basic layout.
Changed project language to scala.
Ignore Android Studio files.
Added '.debug' suffix to debug app's package name.

Changed MainActivity to request bluetooth on start.

If bluetooth is denied, we exit with an error toast.

ContactsFragment now lists all visible devices.

Also added ChatService to handle discovery (only on service start
for now).
Added exit button, reformatted strings.xml.
Use ListFragment for ContactsFragment so empty view works correctly.
Updated to Android 5.0, updated gradle.
Addded basic ping functionality between devices.
Use proper tags for fragment layout.
Only hold weak reference to device listener, return explicit run mode.
Request bluetooth to be discoverable on start.
Added unit test for MainActivity.
Require bluetooth feature to install.
Improved handling for bluetooth enable/disable.
Readme formatting fix.

Added text chat functionality.

- ChatFragment with layout, Fragment handling in MainActivity
- [MessagePack](http://msgpack.org/) serialization in TextMessage
- MessageStore to hold old messages
- various small code enhancements

Way too many changes for one commit, but it's too late to change.
Added TextMessageTest, MessageStoreTest, updated MainActivityTest.

Put proguard back in to avoid OutOfMemoryExceptions.

I removed it earlier because of warnings, but these weren't important.
Removed chat fragment caching.
Updated dependencies, downgrade scala for incremental compiles.

Added message signing.

Also, DeviceInfoMessage is now sent on connect for key exchange,
new abstract class Message is superclass of all message
implementations.

Multiple minor reformats/refactorings.

(De-)serialize message to/from byte array instead of stream.

This lets us get rid of seperate `getBytes` function for signing,
and is needed for end to end encryption.
Require device ID to have correct format using regex.
Moved exit button to ContactsFragment so it isn't shown when chat is open.

Remove device from ContactsFragment when disconnected.

Also changed some variable/class/function names.
Added end-to-end message encryption.
Updated dependencies.

Fix initial connection not working (DeviceInfoMessage should not be
encrypted).
Added EnsiChatActivity to avoid code duplication for service connection.
Added preferences with setting for scan interval.

Added functionality to add contacts (with new Activity).

This requires confirmation from both devices involved, and
allows opening the ChatFragment for a device that is not currently
connected.
Minor code enhancements.

Added identicons based on public key when adding new contact.

Also fixed a derp with cases.
Use assert instead of manual if/exception.
Improved Database tests, added logging for AddContactsActivity.
Fixed adding contact not working.
Layout fixes.
Added proper chat layout.
Improved handling for invalid incoming messages.
Fixed various lint problems, improved navigation (ActionBar up arrows).
Properly implement hashCode().
Made it work
Merge pull request #1065 from Arneball/master

Create 'thin' build type and clean up previous commit.

The 'thin' build type relies on system scala library, while 'debug'
and 'release' provide the library itself.
Use key fingerprints instead of bluetooth addresses.

Moved remaining messages to binary encoding, removed msgpack dependency.

This seems to have added some random disconnects, but there doesn't
seem to be a reason for this in the code.
Refactored packages.
Use case classes, cleaned up code.
Cleaned up header, moved time to text.
Properly close connection.
Reduce CryptoData size by using smaller length fields.
Changed RSA key size to 4096 bits.
Use Future instead of Thread.
Updated dependencies.
Generate local keys before starting any connectivity.
Fixed crash when transitting long messages.
Split ChatService class into BluetoothInterface and new ChatService.
Added user name.
Do not crash when receiving invalid message.
Don't show existing contacts in AddContactsActivity.
Database should implement OnMessageReceivedListener.

Open chat after adding a new contact.

Currently, you have to press back twice in the ContactsFragment after
this to exit the app.
Updated dependencies, use DeviceDefault theme.

Use notification and seperate activity to add contact.

This might cause problems if the activity is closed after choosing
yes, and before the other user confirms. We should probably store
the information in the service.
Made member names lowercase, minor code formatting.
Use listener instead of anonymous function for database contacts update.
Added flood-based routing.
Minor fixes.
Updated readme.
